findings.title: Push pattern for AccountHolder initialization can lead to errors
findings.description: The `AccountHolder` contract is initialized within `onERC721Received` when a Xaya account NFT is transferred to it. This hook is only executed when `safeTransferFrom` is used for transfers, but not for `transferFrom`. Therefore, the usage of `transferFrom` would lead to a situation where the NFT is locked up irrevocably, but the contract is not initialized.

findings.title: isSafe function misses to check right-to-left operator
findings.description: The `isSafe` function in `JsonSubObject.sol` does not check whether the Right To Left Operator is used inside the string which can influence the display of the names.

findings.title: Usage of _msgSender() in Democrit
findings.description: Using `_msgSender()` instead of `msg.sender` can make the code less clear and harder to understand.

findings.title: Different pragma and openzeppelin-contracts versions
findings.description: The pragma versions on both repositories differ, as well as the OpenZeppelin contract versions.

findings.title: Usage of assert throughout the codebase
findings.description: The usage of `assert` instead of `require` throughout the codebase may lead to unintended behavior and gas consumption.

findings.title: @truffle/hdwallet-provider not in delegation package.json
findings.description: The package `@truffle/hdwallet-provider` is required for the project but it is not present in the `package.json` file.
